text:
gm!

Thanks <@UEHLS0JUB> for the review, I just noticed it. Will read carefully.

However I tried running the governance onboarding steps on actual DevNet.
• I successfully created UserServiceRequest and ProviderServiceRequests, and it got accepted
• I could issue decentralized credentials after this, from rust, very cool
• However, when I tried to issue and accept a registrar credential within the same choice, then call RegistrarServiceRequest_Accept, I get
```Credential missing for holder [cbtc-network::12202a83c6f4082217c175e29bc53da5f2703ba2675778ab99217a5a881a949203ff] for requirements: [PartyCredentialRequirement {issuer = 'cbtc-network::12202a83c6f4082217c175e29bc53da5f2703ba2675778ab99217a5a881a949203ff', requiredClaims = [(\\\"hasRegistryRole\\\",\\\"Registrar\\\")]}]\"```
So it seems the credential offer/accept did not go through in the same step (wonder why it didnt blow up at that step in the code then?)

relevant code: <https://github.com/DLC-link/canton/blob/3745edfbd332677fb5199f1eb90cdfd46d05bf11/daml/governance/daml/CBTC/Governance.daml#L163>

~I also notice, that in my daml tests, I have control over the `operator` actions,  and I explicitly set these cred requirements in this line: <https://github.com/DLC-link/canton/blob/3745edfbd332677fb5199f1eb90cdfd46d05bf11/daml/test/daml/CBTC/UtilityOnboarding.daml#L47>~
~But obviously in DevNet, I don't have control over how the providerConfiguration is actually set?~

Thanks! :pray:

text:
Let me change this topic to be about contract upgrades. :smile:

I have uploaded a new version of the governance DAR to DevNet, for all participants, it is a semver patch version higher.

We fetch in rust by fetching Active Contracts for `#cbtc-governance:CBTC.Governance:CBTCGovernanceRules`

Is there anything else I should do? Does this new contract need to be migrated to? Or once they have it, it should automatically use the 'latest' one? Or do I need to run through the relevant bits of the Bootstrapping, where I set members, etc?

elements.text: Let me change this topic to be about contract upgrades.

I have uploaded a new version of the governance DAR to DevNet, for all participants, it is a semver patch version higher.

We fetch in rust by fetching Active Contracts for
#cbtc-governance:CBTC.Governance:CBTCGovernanceRules

Is there anything else I should do? Does this new contract need to be migrated to? Or once they have it, it should automatically use the 'latest' one? Or do I need to run through the relevant bits of the Bootstrapping, where I set members, etc?

text: Thanks. I do use package names everywhere. But I still fetch the old in /active-contracts, does an action first need to happen on it successfully, for it to roll over? At least according to createdEvent.templateId, I see the old packageId returned

elements.text: Thanks. I do use package names everywhere. But I still fetch the old in /active-contracts, does an action first need to happen on it successfully, for it to roll over? At least according to createdEvent.templateId, I see the old packageId returned

text: I actually do use regular templateIds fetched from createdEvent fields, every time I use one as a disclosed contract. But then I take it those should all be template-by-names as well everywhere

Hmmm, encountering
CONTRACT_NOT_FOUND

, when I pass in a credential Cid for Accept HolderService request, even though it says cache hit...
I can also query this contract from the ACS of the dec-party, that's how I got it's CId in the first place, so, odd
How is this possible? Hard to imagine a sync issue as every party in this flow is on one node, except the operator I guess

gm!

Thanks <@UEHLS0JUB> for the review, I just noticed it. Will read carefully.

However I tried running the governance onboarding steps on actual DevNet.
• I successfully created UserServiceRequest and ProviderServiceRequests, and it got accepted
• I could issue decentralized credentials after this, from rust, very cool
• However, when I tried to issue and accept a registrar credential within the same choice, then call RegistrarServiceRequest_Accept, I get
```Credential missing for holder [cbtc-network::12202a83c6f4082217c175e29bc53da5f2703ba2675778ab99217a5a881a949203ff] for requirements: [PartyCredentialRequirement {issuer = 'cbtc-network::12202a83c6f4082217c175e29bc53da5f2703ba2675778ab99217a5a881a949203ff', requiredClaims = [(\\\"hasRegistryRole\\\",\\\"Registrar\\\")]}]\"```
So it seems the credential offer/accept did not go through in the same step (wonder why it didnt blow up at that step in the code then?)

relevant code: <https://github.com/DLC-link/canton/blob/3745edfbd332677fb5199f1eb90cdfd46d05bf11/daml/governance/daml/CBTC/Governance.daml#L163>

~I also notice, that in my daml tests, I have control over the `operator` actions,  and I explicitly set these cred requirements in this line: <https://github.com/DLC-link/canton/blob/3745edfbd332677fb5199f1eb90cdfd46d05bf11/daml/test/daml/CBTC/UtilityOnboarding.daml#L47>~
~But obviously in DevNet, I don't have control over how the providerConfiguration is actually set?~

Thanks! :pray:

text:
Let me rephrase and summarize this better, thanks if you have any ideas :pray:

• I offered a credential to a user from the decparty, with the correct claims
• user accepted it
• user clicks Request HolderService, with the decparty as the Provider
• All good
• I attempt to trigger the acceptance of this request, which takes as args several contractIds, including the credential we just issued&accepted
• I can fetch all of these cIds, and provide them for this call
• but the request fails with it not 'finding' the credentialCId at execution, that we just fetched! And can still fetch. So who is not finding it?

elements.text: Let me rephrase and summarize this better, thanks if you have any ideas
I offered a credential to a user from the decparty, with the correct claims
user accepted it
user clicks Request HolderService, with the decparty as the Provider
All good
I attempt to trigger the acceptance of this request, which takes as args several contractIds, including the credential we just issued&accepted
I can fetch all of these cIds, and provide them for this call
but the request fails with it not 'finding' the credentialCId at execution, that we just fetched! And can still fetch. So who is not finding it?
